sections.1_story_intuition: Appointments and resignations of important personalities are frequently asked in competitive exams, especially in current affairs. This topic covers recent and significant appointments, resignations, and their relevance to government, judiciary, public sector, and international organizations. Mastery of this topic helps candidates answer current GK questions accurately.
2_key_definitions: Appointment: Official selection of a person for a post.
Resignation: Voluntary leaving of a post or office.
Incumbent: Current holder of a position.
Successor: Person who follows another in a post.
Predecessor: Person who held the post before.
Tenure: Period of holding a post.
Cabinet: Group of top government ministers.
Chief Justice: Head of the judiciary.
Chairperson: Head of a committee or organization.
CEO: Chief Executive Officer of a company.
3_key_facts_data_points: President of India appoints the Prime Minister.
Chief Justice of India appointed by the President.
RBI Governor appointed by the Government of India.
Chief Election Commissioner appointed by the President.
Chairman of ISRO appointed by the Government.
UN Secretary-General appointed by the General Assembly.
Recent appointment: Ajay Banga as President of World Bank (2023).
Recent resignation: Uday Kotak as CEO of Kotak Mahindra Bank (2023).
Nirmala Sitharaman: Current Finance Minister of India.
Droupadi Murmu: Current President of India (since 2022).
S. Somanath: Current ISRO Chairman.
Arvind Panagariya: Chairman, 16th Finance Commission (2023).
CJI D.Y. Chandrachud: Chief Justice of India (since 2022).
Sanjay Kumar Mishra: Former ED Director, resigned 2023.
S. Jaishankar: Current External Affairs Minister.
S. Gurumurthy: RBI Central Board Director.
S. Somanath succeeded K. Sivan as ISRO Chairman.
Ajay Banga succeeded David Malpass as World Bank President.
Resignation of Boris Johnson as UK PM (2022).
Appointment of Rishi Sunak as UK PM (2022).
5_exam_capsules: Who is the current President of India? Droupadi Murmu.
Who is the current ISRO Chairman? S. Somanath.
Who is the current Finance Minister? Nirmala Sitharaman.
Who is the current Chief Justice of India? D.Y. Chandrachud.
Who is the current World Bank President? Ajay Banga.
Who resigned as CEO of Kotak Mahindra Bank? Uday Kotak.
Who is the current External Affairs Minister? S. Jaishankar.
Who is the Chairman of 16th Finance Commission? Arvind Panagariya.
Who succeeded K. Sivan as ISRO Chairman? S. Somanath.
Who succeeded David Malpass as World Bank President? Ajay Banga.
Who resigned as UK PM in 2022? Boris Johnson.
Who became UK PM after Boris Johnson? Rishi Sunak.
Who appoints the Prime Minister of India? President of India.
Who appoints the Chief Justice of India? President of India.
Who appoints the RBI Governor? Government of India.
7_traps_confusing_points: Mixing up current and former office holders.
Assuming all resignations are due to scandals.
Mixing up international and national posts.
Confusing Cabinet and Council of Ministers.
Mixing up RBI Governor and Finance Minister.
Assuming all appointments are by the President.

8_case_study_context.title: Ajay Banga: Appointment as World Bank President
8_case_study_context.explanation: Ajay Banga, an Indian-American, was appointed as the President of the World Bank in 2023. His appointment is significant for global finance and India's representation in international organizations.
